column4: Oh, also, there are 2 modules that fail loading (This is Warty) on every machine I've installed it on
And the boot splash doesn't work
oh, ok
assumed there would be
Compatibility concerns?
I heard Ubuntu was working on a kick-ass bootsplash thing that had transitions and other eye candy
everyone was all thrilled
Ubuntu's really bringing some much-needed polish into things
great to see
or gensplash
you can play with the v1 demo code.  http://www.paul.sladen.org/projects/usplash/download/  but the v2 code didn't make it for Hoary
thanks... I'll grab that tonight and have a look
you don't need to relocate to work for Canonical
Well, if I relocate can I still work there? I need a change in pace :)
everyone working for Canonical works from home, which ever country they're in
That's neat... I'm going to get my CV together and send it in for consideration.
Canonical's doing the kind of stuff I always dreamed of starting a company to do. ;)
you can work on Ubuntu without working for Canonical.  ...I sometimes manage that when I remember
Yeah, I am just working on getting a feel for the Ubuntu community and projects... I'll be doing that regardless I think, but I'd love to do it full time
Eating is important
- he's trying to boot into a system using the install cd, not getting that error after grub
